--3-3202572017-9599826045=:7
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello,

I'm pretty new to using heritrix. I know its being developed and
no=
rmally run under linux but i would like to run it under windows.


I manage=
d to get heritrix 1.12 to run by setting environmental
variables like HERIT=
RIX_HOME and USERNAME. The JMX problem worked out
by setting the rights man=
ually via cacls.

that was 1.12.


My problem with 2.0.0 is:

when i run "h=
eritrix -a admin" i'm getting receiving this error
message in the heritrix =
shell window:

No JNDI context.
Engine registered at
org.archive.crawler:in=
stance=3D20918341,jmxport=3D8849,name=3DEngine,type=3Dorg.\
archive.crawler=
.framework.Engine,host=3Doben3
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No path to =
WAR specified, and no WAR
found in ./lib.  Use -w to specify a path to the =
Heritrix WAR file.
    at org.archive.crawler.WebUI.getDefaultPathToWAR(Web=
UI.java:67)
    at org.archive.crawler.WebUI.<init>(WebUI.java:58)
    at o=
rg.archive.crawler.Heritrix.main(Heritrix.java:317)

Q: why is this error o=
ccuring, since HERITRIX_HOME variable is set?

i did what the error told me=
 to do by running "heritrix -a admin
--webUI-war-path lib" (the -w paramete=
r seemed not to be working for
me??) and the heritrix bash actually startet=
 the jetty server.

i checked my local host at http://localhost.com:8080
an=
d i received:

"HTTP ERROR: 503

SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE

RequestURI=3D/

/Powe=
red by jetty://

Q: what was my error?  [:-/]
Q: Did i miss to set any othe=
r environmental variables?

thx in advanced  [:)]
andreas
